Module com.example.JAVAdb
Package com.robertSchofield.JAVAdb.DAOs

Class customerDAO

java.lang.Object
com.robertSchofield.JAVAdb.DAOs.customerDAO
public class customerDAO extends Object
This class provides methods for interacting with the 'customers' table in the database. It includes operations such as retrieving customer data, adding new customers, updating existing customers, deleting customers, and finding customers by ID or name.

  • Method Details

    • listAll

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<customers> listAll()
      Retrieves all customers from the database, including their division and country information.
      Returns:
      An observable list of all customers.

    • getCustDivTotal

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<customers> getCustDivTotal()
      Retrieves a list of customers along with their respective divisions and total number of customers per division.
      Returns:
      An observable list of customers with division and total customers information.

    • add

      public void add(customers customer)
      Adds a new customer to the database.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer object to be added.

    • update

      public void update(customers customer)
      Updates an existing customer in the database.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer object with updated information.

    • delete

      public void delete(customers customer)
      Deletes a customer from the database. If the customer has associated appointments, an alert is displayed and the appointments are deleted before the customer is deleted.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer object to be deleted.

    • findById

      public customers findById(int id)
      Finds a customer by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the customer to be found.
      Returns:
      The customer object with the matching ID, or null if no customer is found.

    • findByName

      public int findByName(String customerName)
      Finds a customer by their name.
      Parameters:
      customerName - The name of the customer to be found.
      Returns:
      The ID of the customer with the matching name, or 0 if no customer is found.
